meanings.definition: Become subject to (something unwelcome or unpleasant) as a result of one's own behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: She incurred a scolding from her teacher for not completing her homework.
meanings.sent2: He incurred a fine for parking in a no-parking zone.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy incurred a stern look from its owner after chewing on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The reckless driver incurred the wrath of other drivers by cutting them off on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The student incurred the consequences of staying up late to finish a project by falling asleep in class.

meanings.definition: Bring upon oneself (something unwelcome or unpleasant) as a result of one's own behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: They incurred the disappointment of their parents by failing the exam.
meanings.sent2: The hiker incurred the ire of park rangers by leaving trash on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter incurred the laughter of the customers by spilling drinks on them.
meanings.sent4: The irresponsible spender incurred the wrath of their bank account by overspending.
meanings.sent5: The forgetful traveler incurred the frustration of missing their flight by arriving late to the airport.
